Indeed, you have joined those concerning whom Allah, the Exalted, said: "As for he who transgressed and preferred the life of this world [al-hayat al-dunya], then indeed, Hellfire will be the refuge [al-ma'wa]." For his community [ummah] is only those who followed him, and none followed him except he who turned away from this world [al-dunya] and turned towards the Hereafter [al-akhirah]. For he called only to Allah and the Last Day [al-yawm al-akhir], and he turned away only from this world [al-dunya] and the immediate gains [al-huzuz al-'ajilah]. Thus, to the extent you have turned away from this world [al-dunya] and turned towards the Hereafter [al-akhirah], you have traversed his path which he traversed. And to the extent you have traversed his path, you have followed him. And to the extent you have followed him, you have become of his community [ummah]. And to the extent you have turned towards this world [al-dunya], you have deviated from his path and desired to abandon following him, and you have joined those concerning whom Allah, the Exalted, said: "As for he who transgressed and preferred the life of this world [al-hayat al-dunya], then indeed, Hellfire will be the refuge [al-ma'wa]." So if you were to emerge from the abode of delusion and be just with yourself, O manâ€”and all of us are that manâ€”you would know that from the time you rise until the time you retire, you strive only for immediate gains [al-huzuz al-'ajilah], and you do not move nor remain still except for the immediate of this world [al-dunya].
